alert.note: Alert for Motherlode; West Slope Northern Sierra Nevada (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 05 at 2:35PM PDT by NWS Sacramento
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northern Placer, southwestern Sierra, northeastern Yuba and central Nevada Counties through 315 PM PDT... At 234 PM PDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Pike, or 10 miles southwest of Downieville, moving northwest at 5 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. Large amounts of small hail are possible. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Baxter, Blue Canyon, Scotts Flat, Alleghany, White Cloud Campground, Cherokee, Pike, Camptonville and Skillman Campground. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.

area.areaDesc: Motherlode; West Slope Northern Sierra Nevada
